analyzed: eka citta khaṇikā sabbe dhammā ti

original: Citte mahāpathavī saṇṭhāti, mahāsamuddo saṇṭhāti, sinerupabbatarājā saṇṭhāti, āpo saṇṭhāti, tejo saṇṭhāti, vāyo saṇṭhāti, tiṇakaṭṭhavanappatayo saṇṭhahantīti?
analyzed: citte mahā pathavī saṇṭhāti mahā samuddaḥ saṇṭhāti sineru pabbata rājā saṇṭhāti āpaḥ saṇṭhāti tejaḥ saṇṭhāti vāyo saṇṭhāti tiṇakaṭṭhavana patayaḥ saṇṭhahanti iti
translated: “Do the great earth, the great ocean, Sineru, king of mountains, water, fire, wind, grass, wood, and stumps settle down in a single moment of consciousness?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …

analyzed: eka citta khaṇikā sabbe dhammā ti

translated: “Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: “ajjhattikañceva, āvuso, cakkhuṁ aparibhinnaṁ hoti, bāhirā ca rūpā na āpāthaṁ āgacchanti, no ca tajjo samannāhāro hoti, neva tāva tajjassa viññāṇabhāgassa pātubhāvo hoti.
analyzed: ajjhattikam ca iva āvuso cakkhum a paribhinnam hoti bāhirā ca rūpā na āpātham āgacchanti no ca tajjaḥ samannāhāro hoti na iva tāva tajjassa viññāṇa bhāgassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti
translated: ‘If the internal eye is intact, but external forms do not come into its range, and there is no corresponding engagement, then the corresponding type of consciousness does not occur.

original: Ajjhattikañceva, āvuso, cakkhuṁ aparibhinnaṁ hoti, bāhirā ca rūpā āpāthaṁ āgacchanti, no ca tajjo samannāhāro hoti, neva tāva tajjassa viññāṇabhāgassa pātubhāvo hoti.
analyzed: ajjhattikam ca iva āvuso cakkhum a paribhinnam hoti bāhirā ca rūpā āpātham āgacchanti no ca tad jo samannāhāraḥ hoti na iva tāva tad jassa viññāṇa bhāgassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti
translated: “Friend, though the eye is intact internally and forms come into its range externally, if there is no corresponding activation, then there is no manifestation of the corresponding section of consciousness.

original: Yato ca kho, āvuso, ajjhattikañceva cakkhuṁ aparibhinnaṁ hoti, bāhirā ca rūpā āpāthaṁ āgacchanti, tajjo ca samannāhāro hoti, evaṁ tajjassa viññāṇabhāgassa pātubhāvo hotī”ti.
analyzed: yatas ca kho āvuso ajjhattikam ca iva cakkhum a paribhinnam hoti bāhirā ca rūpā āpātham āgacchanti tad jo ca samannāhāraḥ hoti evam tad jassa viññāṇa bhāgassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti iti
translated: But when the eye is intact internally and forms come into its range externally and there is the corresponding activation, then there is the manifestation of the corresponding section of consciousness.”

analyzed: cakkhu āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇena sahajātanti  sotāyatanam pe  ghāna āyatanam pe
translated: “The eye sense-sphere is conascent with eye-consciousness.”🔽“The ear sense-sphere …🔽The nose sense-sphere …
The body sense-sphere is conascent with body-consciousness?”
“The body sense-sphere is conascent with body-consciousness?”

original: “ajjhattiko ceva, āvuso, kāyo aparibhinno hoti, bāhirā ca phoṭṭhabbā na āpāthaṁ āgacchanti, no ca …pe…🔽ajjhattiko ceva, āvuso, kāyo aparibhinno hoti, bāhirā ca phoṭṭhabbā āpāthaṁ āgacchanti, no ca …pe…
analyzed: ajjhattikaḥ ca iva āvuso kāyaḥ a paribhinnaḥ hoti bāhirā ca phoṭṭhabbāḥ na āpātham āgacchanti no ca pe  ajjhattikaḥ ca iva āvuso kāyaḥ a paribhinnaḥ hoti bāhirā ca phoṭṭhabbāḥ āpātham āgacchanti no ca pe
translated: “If the internal body is intact and external tactile objects don’t come into its range, and there’s no corresponding engagement, then there’s no manifestation of the corresponding section of consciousness.🔽If the internal body is intact and external tactile objects come into its range, and there’s corresponding engagement, then there’s a manifestation of the corresponding section of consciousness.

original: yato ca kho, āvuso, ajjhattiko ceva kāyo aparibhinno hoti, bāhirā ca phoṭṭhabbā āpāthaṁ āgacchanti, tajjo ca samannāhāro hoti, evaṁ tajjassa viññāṇabhāgassa pātubhāvo hotī”ti.
analyzed: yatas ca kho āvuso ajjhattikaḥ ca iva kāyaḥ a paribhinnaḥ hoti bāhirā ca phoṭṭhabbāḥ āpātham āgacchanti tad jo ca samannāhāraḥ hoti evam tad jassa viññāṇa bhāgassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti iti
translated: “If the internal body is intact and external tactile objects don’t come into its range, and there is no corresponding conscious engagement, then there is no manifestation of the corresponding section of consciousness.”

analyzed: kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇena sahajātanti  na vattabba
translated: “Well then, you shouldn’t say that the body sense-sphere is conascent with body-consciousness.”

analyzed: eka citta khaṇikā sabbe dhammā ti  āmantā
translated: “You shouldn’t say that all things are momentary.”

original: Sabbe dhammā niccā dhuvā sassatā avipariṇāmadhammāti?
analyzed: sabbe dhammā niccā dhuvā sassatā a vipariṇāma dhammā ti
translated: “All things are permanent, stable, eternal, not subject to change.”

original: Tena hi ekacittakkhaṇikā sabbe dhammāti.🔽Khaṇikakathā niṭṭhitā.🔽Bāvīsatimo vaggo.
analyzed: tena hi eka citta khaṇikā sabbe dhammā ti  khaṇika kathā niṭṭhitā  bāvīsatimaḥ vaggo
translated: “Well then, all things are momentary.”🔽The Discussion of Momentariness is finished.🔽The twentieth section is finished.

original: Atthi kiñci saṁyojanaṁ appahāya parinibbānaṁ,🔽arahā kusalacitto parinibbāyati,
analyzed: atthi kiñci sayojanam a pahāya parinibbāna  arahā kusala citto parinibbāyati
translated: Is there any fetter that one does not abandon in reaching Arahantship?🔽Does an Arahant attain Arahantship by a profitable cognizance?
Does an Arahant attain Arahantship by a state of imperturbability?

analyzed: atthi gabbhaseyyāya dhamma abhisamayaḥ  atthi gabbhaseyyāya arahatta ppatti
translated: Is there a penetration of ideas while lying in the womb?🔽Is there an Arahantship while lying in the womb?
Is there a penetration of ideas while dreaming?

original: atthi supinagatassa arahattappatti,🔽sabbaṁ supinagatassa cittaṁ abyākataṁ,
analyzed: atthi supina gatassa arahatta ppatti  sabbam supina gatassa cittam
translated: Is there an Arahantship while dreaming?🔽Is all cognizance of one dreaming indeterminate?
Is there any conditionality in repetition?

analyzed: eka citta khaṇikā sabbe dhammā ti
